transcripts.text: Hey, Michael.  Hey.  How you doing?  Thanks for waiting.  Yeah, thanks for joining us.  Michael Moore.  So you brought down the house as usual.  What did you think of the debate last night?  It's a beautiful place.  Yes, it is.  What did you think of the debate last night?  Because it seemed to me that there was a lot of poll-tested, consultant-tested phrasing, you know, Pete with the turn the page, and a lot of that language about unity, this and that, but Bernie seemed to be the one talking about the urgency of now.

Step up here.  We're getting on flat ground.  This is a really old place.  They built this before there were building codes.  I think, I gotta tell you, I actually like the debate, and I like the fact that every one of the candidates said something that I applauded.  I noticed we were at the Bernie debate watch party, and I was like the only one applauding some of the other candidates, but I think we should applaud them.  when they speak out against endless war, When Biden goes over and hugs Bernie, things like that, I thought it was good.  And Klobuchar, man, there's always a moment when a candidate is... I don't want to say it's over.  It's not over.  But boy, she put the slow knife with a smile on her face right in Pete Buttigieg.  And he looked every bit as not ready for prime time as he actually is.  And it wasn't her words.  She quoted his words.  While they were there taking their job seriously, her and Elizabeth and Bernie in the Senate with a Trump trial.  He was in Iowa mocking them and saying that he'd rather be watching cartoons.  This was one of the most important constitutional moments in our history.  there literally is a criminal in the White House who at least Nixon tried to cover up his crimes.  you know this guy is proud of them and has signaled that he's going to commit more of them.  so I wonder where the line is for most people and for Buttigieg to just kind of fluff it off like it was.  I'd rather be watching cartoons.  um man I don't know.  That was a real disqualifying moment for him.
I want to ask you because Bernie, you know, Bernie's version of the knife was your 40 billionaires.  And Pete kind of pivoted.  Well, we need everything we can to go against Trump.

But I mean, let me just I'll do I'll do my my impression of Pete when he was asked about his 40 billionaires.  They're people, too.  They're Americans, too.  You know, Bernie was great with that, as was Elizabeth.  I mean, they really, I think that they had been somewhat timid to go after him before this moment.  And I understand that, you know, liberals were really, part of what's kind of good about liberals is that we have a heart And we're happy when things happen.  But it's not enough just to be happy that, you know, you're African American and you're on the Supreme Court, Clarence Thomas.  Or you're a woman and you're invading countries, Margaret Thatcher.  You know, I mean, it's kind of like you can take the identity thing to a certain point, which you should.  Because you and I, as white guys, have a responsibility to fix things.  to fix the damage that was done to this country and to this planet by the white guys that came before us.  And it has fallen upon us to turn this thing around.  But not to the point where we put the wrong people in there who have basically said, we're not going to do anything to turn it around.  We're just going to give you more of the same old, same old.  Well, okay, you know, I was happy to see that Pete Buttigieg was in this race.  Then I learned that his husband grew up down the street from where I live in Michigan.  Hey, you know, that's pretty cool.  South Bend, we all know South Bend in Michigan.  The city limits essentially is on the Michigan state border.  So we all know South Bend.

Let's talk about Michigan.  You were one of the ones who predicted that Donald Trump was going to win.  You were alone on an island back then with Roger and me.  A lot of people have joined you finally seeing what's been going on to places like Flint, Detroit, South Bend, the gentrification, the pushing of poor people further and further out.  But we hear from MSNBC, you know, the usual suspects, you could only beat Trump with a moderate.  But Bernie just brought out more young people in Iowa than Obama did in 2008.  He just brought out more Latinos and Muslims.
You guys are the only ones saying that.
You know, independent media is important, isn't it?

And should be supported.  Seriously, I mean, I can't tell you how many times I hear from people, people that are, you know, my social media followers, they're so grateful for the Young Turks for putting it out there in a way that nobody will put it out there, covering the things that don't get covered.  Like the thing I mentioned here, that Bernie, of all the candidates, has more contributions from active duty service than any of the other candidates.  And the looks on people's faces, because I could see them, because they were like, what?  But you see, they don't want the public to hear that.  And I alluded to, we stopped by this bar in Manchester last night, and the pundit class was there, the official pundit class.
Was Chris Matthews there?  Because last night he was having trouble.  He suggested Bernie might, you know, there might be assassinations in Central Park.  I don't know if you saw that.

I'll say this as a fellow Irish Catholic about Chris.  We are known to have a great sense of humor.  I learned it at an early age.  It's either I should develop a good sense of humor or become a really good drinker.  And I know you can do both, but I'd rather encourage people to go with a sense of humor.

What are your thoughts on what happened with the DNC?  Because I spoke with Nina Turner last night, basically said whether incompetence or not, it seemed to be intentional, what they did in Iowa.  Bernie was about to be declared the winner.  Tom Perez comes out calling for re-canvassing.

Minutes before Bernie was going to have that press conference and explain why he won Iowa.  And they did that to sandbag him.  I ran into Tom Perez last night after the debate.  And his people tried to block me from, like, reaching into him, which I did.  You know, don't block me, for Christ's sake.  You know?  I said, Tom, you and I need to talk.  Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah.  No, no, no.  We need to talk.  I'm coming to D.C.  and we're going to talk.  Because you can't, you know, they took him away.  The DNC can't screw this up.  They have a moral responsibility to make sure that we remove Trump.  And I am starting to detect from some of these DNC types that it's actually more important that they save their old corrupt system full of hacks.  That's more important to them than getting rid of Trump.  Anybody who puts anything ahead of when Hillary says that she doesn't know if she can endorse the candidate, meaning Bernie.  then you've just told me something about yourself.  And that's pretty rotten and pretty scary.  That it would actually be better to have Trump than Bernie.  That's exactly what she said.  She didn't say it in those words, but that's what Biden said when he said he didn't know if he could commit to endorsing Bernie.  And on and on and on.  And that's why another whole segment of the Democratic Party hack establishment is backing Bloomberg.  He's now their great white hope because Biden isn't doing so well.  They thought Pete maybe could be, but I don't think that's going to go very well.  Who knows?
Bernie supporters watching at home very anxious because it looks like what they're doing now makes 2016 look like child's play.

You should be anxious.  You should be very worried.  They've got more money than us.  They hold the power.  Here's the power we hold.  We've got more people.  There are more people that believe in the things that we believe in than what they believe in.  A lot more.  By tens of millions more.  So, what do we do with that?  How do we organize that?  Because it will not happen just with people sitting at home watching this or looking at your device or listening to this on the way to work or whatever.  It is time to make a stand and make it now.  Do not plan on making the stand in the summer.  It has to be made right now in February.  We have to go full tilt against what the DNC is doing about this, that Iowa vote.  I mean, I cannot believe.  Back to back, I was there in Des Moines.  On Sunday, the Des Moines Register is prohibited from releasing their poll, their vaunted, the big poll.
Gold standard.

Gold standard.  And because Pete Buttigieg says that one of his followers got a phone call from the pollster and didn't mention Pete's name, all of a sudden they throw the whole poll out.  Of course, it leaks, and then we learn that Bernie came in number one in the poll.  Not him at a distant third.  At a distant third, and they didn't want that out, and they killed the poll on Sunday, and they killed the caucus on Monday.  And part of the killing of the caucus was just plain stupid incompetence.  We've had a joke the last few days that whenever we see somebody like just total incompetence, there's a piece of the Iowa Democratic Party everywhere, it seems.  But beyond that, beyond the incompetence, we have to get to the bottom.  of why in those precincts, that were Bernie precincts, where there's all this miscalculation that the Times pointed out, we have to get to the... Bernie and the others, they've got to move on.  They've got New Hampshire, and then they've got South Carolina and Nevada.  We don't have to move on.  This show, you guys, me, others, we have to make sure that we have the exact count in Iowa.  Because my guess is that Bernie is not only going to be ahead in the popular vote, which all the candidates agree that Bernie won by the number of votes, but also head in the delegates.  So we can't let this go.  We can't let it happen anywhere else.  There are things taking place right now, and look, I'm not a conspiracy theorist.  I don't live my life in like, you know.  But please trust, we've lived long enough now.  We've been around this block once before, twice before, depending on how old you are, ten times before.  This is, they are not going to stop.  They are not going to give up on trying to stop Bernie.  And whether it's the Bloomberg angle to do it, whether it's fiddling with the vote, and you've got all these people from the Hillary campaign that gave us that app.  The COO, the CEO, the CTO of Shadow, great name, and its parent, Acronym, they're all people from the Hillary 2016 campaign.
The CEO of Acronym is married to a Pete Buttigieg staffer.

Yeah, just a staffer.  He's a key senior political strategist for the campaign.  And who was the number one client of Shadow?  The Pete Buttigieg campaign, $42,000 that they gave this company.  Look, it may mean nothing, it may mean everything, but to ignore it and to not... You know, boy, if you ever found out something like that about me, I hope you guys would tear me a new one because that can't just lay there.  We have to find out what was going on here.  And for Pete Buttigieg to be involved two days in a row with first the trashing of the Des Moines Register poll so that we're not supposed to know what the poll really said, and then people from the Hillary campaign One of whom, as you said, is married to one of the key Buttigieg people and the Buttigieg financial arrangement with the app company.  We have a right to ask questions.  And I'll tell you, people right now are, you know, no, don't attack the Democrats.  Don't attack the Democratic Party.  My friends, if we do not speak up now.  Yeah, I agree.  The time to not attack them is on November 1st.  you know, two days before the election.  I agree with that.  Because we have to get rid of Trump.  But now's the time, because if we don't take care of this now, if we don't make this an honest election now, we'll never have a chance to change the things that we need to change.  And we'll just feed right into Trump's hand so he can say, look at these Democrats.  They can't organize their way out of a paper bag.  And they are about rigging elections.

Last question.  I've reported in Flint since 2016 going on, I think, 15 times.  Obviously, yes, you are a hero there.  It doesn't get mentioned in the media much.  Obviously, not much on the campaign trail.  We're going on six years now.  Rick Snyder's administration claimed the water was better, but I've been there.  There's still problems.  The people in Flint are still shell-shocked.  I've seen people still with rashes as recently as last year, babies forgetting the alphabet, children forgetting letters in the alphabet.  I mean, you go down the list.  It really is still a crisis and it doesn't get that attention.  Why would Bernie Sanders be the right president to make places like Flint that have gone through this privatization turned crisis to really help the people of Flint?

Bernie, and of course I'm not authorized to speak for him, but I will.  Bernie as President immediately is going to involve himself with the Flint water problem.  They call it a water crisis, but the truth is that political decisions were made that poisoned the people and then they were covered up.  You know, I believe Bernie will do what I asked President Obama to do.  Please send in the Army Corps of Engineers, dig up all the poison pipes, not just the main lines down the street, but all the lines into people's homes and all the internal plumbing in people's homes has all been ruined by the lead poisoning.  All of that has to be fixed.  This isn't rocket science.  This isn't like, tell me the cure for lung cancer.  This is like, can you go in, can you send the Army Corps of Engineers in, dig up the pipes and replace them with brand new pipes, modern pipes, where the people won't be poisoned.  You know, it'll take a little less than a year.  It's a project.  But it can be done and should have started four years ago.  So that's, I'm going to count on Bernie doing that.
How about expanded Medicare for all for them first?  I mean, a lot of these people are the thousands and thousands of dollars in medical bills.

Medicare for all, actually, they should sign the bill in Flint.  It should start with the poisoned people of Flint.  And I like to say, too, if we ever need a draft, if we truly are in need of a draft, the first ones drafted should be the sons and daughters of the members of Congress and of the CEOs of corporate America.  They go first so that we never go into another war again.  We should never be in a war unless we're actually, you and I, are in serious attack.  That's the only reason to ever use our military, to defend the lives of the people here.  Other than that, they want to start a war, send their own kids first.
Thank you so much, Michael.  Really appreciate it.

Thank you very much.  I'm very, actually very hopeful, even after this rough week.  I know that's amazing to be able to say that, but after we saw what Trump did this week, what the Senate did with Trump.
That State of the Union that looked like it was out of a horror movie.

That was so, I swear to God, that State of the Union message, which Nancy Pelosi appropriately called, it wasn't the State of the Union, it was the state of his mind.  That's what we heard for a couple of hours, the state of Trump's mind.  That tape of that performance by him will be the new Reefer Madness movie of the next decade.  Is that too old of a reference?  It's basically what you will watch as you get high.  So there you go.
Well, I think Medal of Honor on you rather than Rush Limbaugh would be in order.  I admire your work quite a bit.
Thank you very much.  I am an Eagle Scout.  That was good enough.  I'm set with medals.

Thank you, Michael.  Appreciate it.  Hope you enjoyed that last video.  Hop on over to statusku.com where you can sign up for our email list and become a member for as low as $5 to $10 a month.  Membership is how we grow.  That's statusku.com slash join.  And remember, join our email list so we can grow the revolution with you.
